definitions.definition: A divalent radical or anion containing two oxygen atoms linked by a covalent bond ; any substance containing this group yields hydrogen peroxide when treated with an acid .
Hydrogen peroxide , especially when in an aqueous solution used as a bleach .
Any compound containing the functional group R-O-O-R'.

main_definition: ( inorganic chemistry ) A divalent radical or anion containing two oxygen atoms linked by a covalent bond ; any substance containing this group yields hydrogen peroxide when treated with an acid .
secondary_definitions: Hydrogen peroxide , especially when in an aqueous solution used as a bleach .
( organic chemistry ) Any compound containing the functional group R-O-O-R'.
